revised_title: Observation of a Luminous Sky Phenomenon in 1734
tldr: In March 1734, John Bevis observed a luminous appearance in the sky over London. The phenomenon resembled an aurora borealis but was stationary and did not have a nucleus. It extended from Gemini to Leo and lasted about an hour before dimming and separating into two parts. Bevis could not find a similar occurrence afterward, and the phenomenon remains unexplained.
